function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Spores being resistant to UVGI can lead to ineffective removal of biological agents.","Impact":"Increased risk of biological agents circulating in the air, leading to potential infections and diseases.","Mitigation":"Use combination design of UVGI systems with high-efficiency filtration for more effective removal of biological agents.","Technologies":"High-efficiency air filtration in conjunction with UVGI systems.","People":"Building occupants, healthcare workers, patients, visitors.","Owner":"Facility management, healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Effectiveness of UVGI depends strongly on the type of virus nucleic acid, leading to varying susceptibility to UV inactivation.","Impact":"Potential ineffectiveness of UVGI in inactivating certain viruses, increasing the risk of viral transmission.","Mitigation":"Conduct regular studies on virus susceptibility to UVGI to ensure effectiveness, and utilize supplemental control measures in addition to UVGI.","Technologies":"Regular studies on virus susceptibility, supplemental measures such as upper-room UVGI installations.","People":"Building occupants, healthcare workers, patients, visitors.","Owner":"Facility management, healthcare organizations, research institutions."},{"Description":"High RH (relative humidity) providing protection against UV-induced DNA or RNA damage for viruses.","Impact":"Risk of viruses being less susceptible to UVGI under high RH, leading to potential ineffectiveness of UVGI.","Mitigation":"Implement measures to control and maintain RH levels to ensure the effectiveness of UVGI, and utilize supplemental control measures in addition to UVGI.","Technologies":"RH control systems, supplemental control measures such as upper-room UVGI installations.","People":"Building occupants, healthcare workers, patients, visitors.","Owner":"Facility management, healthcare organizations."}]}
